description: From New Latin diencephalon, from Ancient Greek δια- (dia-, “through”) + ἐγκέφαλος (enképhalos, “brain”).

entries.meaning: (neuroanatomy, anatomy) The region of the human brain, specifically the human forebrain, that includes the thalamus, the hypothalamus, the epithalamus, the prethalamus or subthalamus, and the pretectum.
